sentences.english: No, officer, I'm sorry I donn't even know what the speed is on this road.
sentences.chinese: 我連這條路的限速是多少多不知道。

sentences.english: The system also observes overtaking rules and speed limits.
sentences.chinese: 系統還能觀察超車換道規則和最高限速。

sentences.english: The speed limiter is to limit the installation of the elevator car speeding down devices.
sentences.chinese: 而限速器是限制電梯轎廂超速下行的安裝裝置。

sentences.english: That's twice the speed limit on that section of the track.
sentences.chinese: 這個速度是該段限速的兩倍。

sentences.english: The speed limiter is an indispensable auxiliary apparatus in the internal combustion engine used in a forklift.
sentences.chinese: 限速器是叉車用內燃式發動機中必不可少的附屬裝置。

sentences.english: Whenever a speed limit change is proposed there is a good deal of public debate.
sentences.chinese: 汽車限速規定的改變總能夠引起一陣軒然的討論。
這裏的限速是45英里每小時。

sentences.english: Any day now, you expect to hear rumblings about bringing back the 55 mile-per-hour speed limit.
sentences.chinese: 最近美國或將重拾55英里限速規定的傳言比比皆是。

sentences.english: It is dangerous for any driver to ignore eed limit.
sentences.chinese: 對於任何一個駕駛員來說，無視限速是危險的。

sentences.english: The law of influence of the suspension and tyre on the limiting speed are analysed.
sentences.chinese: 研究了懸架和輪胎等參數對極限速度的影響規律。
這裏的限速是每小時45英里。

sentences.english: Looks like there's a lot of people in town for speed week, huh?
sentences.chinese: 極限速度挑戰賽來了不少人啊，是嗎？

sentences.english: And the dynamic characteristics of trains flow in speed limit section of main-line railway are analyzed.
sentences.chinese: 隨後對幹線鐵路中限速區段交通流的特性進行了分析。

sentences.english: If you drive so fast in the speed-limited area, you will be asking for trouble.
sentences.chinese: 如果你在限速區開快車，你可是自找麻煩。

sentences.english: Speed governors can make sure the operational safety of gasoline fork lift truck.
sentences.chinese: 限速器可以保證汽油叉車的工作安全性。

sentences.english: Time will always slow down just enough to protect the speed limit.
sentences.chinese: 時間總是放緩來保護極限速度。

definition: to exceed the speed limit/to speed/high-speed
to travel along a route (of vehicles etc)
highway/expressway/same as 高速公路[gao1 su4 gong1 lu4]
to drive a vehicle/movement of vehicles
road condition(s) (e.g. surface, traffic flow etc)
